name: Emission Permit Regulations
description: 1000 Emission Permits guarantee a Citizen 1 PPM a day of tax free Air Pollution.

properties.Title: Daily check on Emission Permits
properties.UserDescription: Once a day, check if a citizen polluted more than their amount of Emission Permits allows. If they did, the difference (so the Emission Permits that are missing to fully cover the pollution) is taxed by 0.05€ per missing Emission Permit. This means that missing some Emission Permits one day isn't as bad but it would have been better to just buy them outright.

User.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen currently being processed for the timer event.

properties.Title: Inactivity Rebuy on Emission Permits
properties.UserDescription: The government buys back Emission Permits from people that are not active at a rate of 3% of their wealth every 3 hours. The Emission Permits are being bought at a price of 0.5€ per Emission Permit. The payment comes out of the Meteor Store Budget as that is the most likely to hold money, and also contains all emission permits for sale right now (so permit sales automatically refill the Meteor Store)

properties.Title: Individual Warning on pollution
properties.UserDescription: A citizen can enter !pollution to receive a warning message if they are over their daily limit of air pollution covered by Emission Permits

properties.Title: Track individual Pollution
properties.UserDescription: when a citizen pollutes the air, they "consume" emission permits for the day (they do not disappear but can't be used for tax-free pollution anymore). The unit for this stat is 1 Emission Permit or 1 mili-PPM (0.001 PPM)

Person.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the pollution.

LeftNumber.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PolluteAir">Pollution In PPM</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PolluteAir">Pollution In PPM</ecoicon>: Amount of carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere this interval (30 seconds) in Parts Per Million.

When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PolluteAir">Pollution In PPM</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PolluteAir">Pollution In PPM</ecoicon>: Amount of carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere this interval (30 seconds) in Parts Per Million.
